title: NIPS_2016_80_abs

sentences.text: Fast algorithms for nearest neighbor -LRB- NN -RRB- search have in large part focused on 2 distance .
Here we develop an approach for 1 distance that begins with an explicit and exactly distance-preserving embedding of the points into 2 2 .
We show how this can efficiently be combined with random-projection based methods for 2 NN search , such as locality-sensitive hashing -LRB- LSH -RRB- or random projection trees .
We rigorously establish the correctness of the methodology and show by experimentation using LSH that it is competitive in practice with available alternatives .

Entity-the_methodology.label: the methodology
Entity-the_methodology.description: The approach for nearest neighbor search at a distance other than Euclidean, which involves an explicit embedding of points into higher-dimensional space and combines it with random-projection based methods.

Entity-an_approach_for_1_distance.description: A method for nearest neighbor search using a single-distance metric, which involves explicitly preserving distances by embedding points into a higher-dimensional space.

Entity-random-projection_based_method.description: A computational technique that uses randomness to project high-dimensional data into a lower-dimensional space for efficient nearest neighbor search.

summary: Fast algorithms for nearest neighbor -LRB- NN -RRB- search have in large part focused on 2 distance . Here we develop an approach for 1 distance that begins with an explicit and exactly distance-preserving embedding of the points into 2 2 . We show how this can efficiently be combined with random-projection based methods for 2 NN search , such as locality-sensitive hashing -LRB- LSH -RRB- or random projection trees . We rigorously establish the correctness of the methodology and show by experimentation using LSH that it is competitive in practice with available alternatives .

Predicate-have_focused_on.label: have focused on
Predicate-have_focused_on.description: To indicate that a subject has concentrated its attention or efforts primarily on an object, often with the intention of understanding, analyzing, or improving it.

Predicate-focused_on.label: focused on
Predicate-focused_on.description: The predicate 'focused on' indicates that the subject (in this case, algorithms) has a specific area of attention or concentration directed towards the object (here, 2 distance). This relationship suggests that the subject's primary interest lies within the scope defined by the object.

Predicate-combine.label: combine
Predicate-combine.description: To combine means to unite or merge two or more entities (concepts, ideas, things, etc.) into a single entity that retains characteristics from each of its components. This predicate indicates an action of integration, fusion, or synthesis between the subject and object, resulting in a new whole with properties derived from both.

Predicate-be_used_for.label: be used for
Predicate-be_used_for.description: The predicate 'be used for' indicates a functional relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (a method or technique) serves as a means to achieve or accomplish something, which is described by the object. In general, this predicate implies a purposeful connection between the two entities.

Predicate-establishes_the_correctness_of.label: establishes the correctness of
Predicate-establishes_the_correctness_of.description: The predicate 'establishes the correctness of' indicates a process of verification or validation that confirms the accuracy and reliability of the object. It implies a thorough examination or investigation to ensure the object meets certain standards, criteria, or expectations.

Predicate-can_be_combined_with.label: can be combined with
Predicate-can_be_combined_with.description: Indicates a relationship where two entities (subject and object) are capable of being integrated or merged to form a new entity, process, or concept. This predicate suggests that the subject can be unified with the object to achieve a common goal, create a novel approach, or produce a specific outcome.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject is a concrete realization or manifestation of the abstract idea or class denoted by the object.
